intro: Astronia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered astronia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic in shape, and have a smooth upper surface. The flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and prominent stamens, making it an attractive species for ornamental purposes.
